title: 104_hr3759
content:
The "Exports, Jobs, and Growth Act of 1996" amends various sections of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. Changes include adjusting income levels, increasing the ceiling on investment insurance to $25 billion, raising the ceiling on financing to $20 billion, and updating the issuing authority year to 2001. SEC. 103 increases the financing ceiling to $20 billion. SEC. 104 updates the issuing authority year to 2001. SEC. 105 amends policy guidance to increase US exports and complement trade policy. SEC. 106 establishes a Board of Directors. Section 233(b) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to make changes to the Board of Directors, including the appointment of a Chairman and Vice Chairman designated by the President of the United States. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to establish a Chairman and Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors, designated by the President of the United States. TITLE II--TRADE AND DEVELOPMENT AGENCY

SEC. 201. TRADE AND DEVELOPMENT AGENCY AUTHORIZATION.

Section 661(f)(1)(A) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to authorize $40,000,000 for fiscal 1997 and necessary sums for fiscal year 1998.

TITLE III--EXPORT PROMOTION PROGRAMS WITHIN THE INTERNATIONAL TRADE ADMINISTRATION

SEC. 301. EXPORT PROMOTION AUTHORIZATION.

Section 202 of the Export Administration Amendments Act of 1985 is amended to authorize $240,000,000 for fiscal year 1997 and necessary sums for fiscal year 1998.

TITLE IV--TRADE PROMOTION COORDINATING COMMITTEE

SEC. 401. STRATEGIC EXPORT PLAN. "Authorization of appropriations for export promotion programs to the Department of Commerce is set at $240,000,000 for fiscal year 1997 and necessary sums for fiscal year 1998. The Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee is tasked with identifying means for coordinated export promotion services for small- and medium-sized businesses and establishing priorities for promoting US exports and free market reforms in the Middle East." SEC. 402. IMPLEMENTATION OF PRIMARY OBJECTIVES. The Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee will identify overlap and duplication in Federal export promotion activities, promote coordination between State, Federal, and private sector export promotion activities, and include these matters in the annual report by September 30, 1997. SEC. 403. PRIVATE SECTOR DEVELOPMENT IN THE UKRAINE. The Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee will report on efforts to promote US trade and investment for private sector development in Ukraine in the 1997 annual report.
